content: this pattern is also available for free on my website here 1 learn to crochet a textural cabled baby blanket with gorgeous ombre color changes and amazing softness the misty dawn crochet baby blanket pattern is an easy-to-memorize four-row repeat with enough variety in stitches to really keep things interesting i love the texture of crocheted cables and these thin cables are super easy to learn even if you ve never done cabling before the bobblet stitches or mini bobbles are subtle but add a fun effect as well the waistcoat stitch is very popular right now for its knit-like appearance in my opinion it looks nicest when worked in the round so it is perfect for a blanket border the whole blanket comes together beautifully with that amazing ombre yarn i hope you enjoy this pattern abbreviations us chain s chain s fpdc s front post double_crochet s repeat repeat round round rs right side single_crochet s single_crochet s skip skip slip_stitch s slip_stitch es st s stitch es ws wrong side special stitches bobblet insert your hook in st yo pull up a loop you will have 2 loops on your hook chain 2 you will still have 2 loops on your hook yo and pull through both loops waistcoat stitch also known as csc center single_crochet insert your hook in the center of the v that makes up the body of the single_crochet below yo and pull up a loop you will have 2 loops on your hook yo and pull through both loops materials juniper moon farm cumulus rainbow weight 4 medium 94% cotton 6% nylon 251yds/229m 3 52oz/100g misty dawn 5 skeins i/9 5 5mm crochet hook stitch markers scissors tapestry needle finished size 32 5″ x 36 5″ with border | 29″ x 33″ before border gauge 11 sts x 15 row in single_crochet = 4″ x 4″ 1 https //dananield com/misty-dawn-crochet-baby-blanket/
